question.title: Usage of apiElements and runtimeElements configurations with Gradle java-library plugin
question.body:
The Gradle java-library plugin lists various configurations that can be used to declare dependencies.

Table 2. Java Library plugin â€” configurations used by consumers
+--------------------+------------------------------------+-------------+-------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Configuration name |                Role                | Consumable? | Resolvable? |                                                         Description                                                          |
+--------------------+------------------------------------+-------------+-------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| apiElements        | For compiling against this library | yes         | no          | This configuration is meant to be used by consumers, to retrieve all the elements necessary to compile against this library. |
| runtimeElements    | For executing this library         | yes         | no          | This configuration is meant to be used by consumers, to retrieve all the elements necessary to run against this library.     |
+--------------------+------------------------------------+-------------+-------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

The only reference I was able to find regarding the usage of these configurations is a question in the Gradle forum, which received a curt response in passing.

apiElements and runtimeElements are not important for end users, they are mostly there for plugin authors to wire in custom Configurations.

This is just as useless as the Table 2 in the docs, because neither show any real-world use cases for these configurations.

Can folks here shed some light?
